problem: During a race, Bob started sprinting from the point $(5, 0)$ on the x-axis at a speed of $8\ \text{m/s}$ for $10$ seconds. Calculate his x-coordinate when he stops.
solution: To find Bob's final position, use the formula $x = v \cdot t$, where $v$ is the speed and $t$ is the time. Given that $v = 8\ \text{m/s}$ and $t = 10\ \text{s}$, the distance he covered is $x = 8 \cdot 10 = 80\ \text{m}$. Starting from $(5, 0)$ on the x-axis, his final x-coordinate is $5 + 80 = \boxed{85}$.
